DOC.brief_summary: It will be hypothesized that strengthening the calf muscles will improve standing efficiency in children with spastic diplegia.
DOC.brief_title: Calf Muscle Strength and Standing Efficiency in Children With Spastic Diplegia
DOC.criteria: Children age will be ranging between 2 and 4 years. They are classified at level III by GMFCSER, i.e. they can stand with minimal support. Full mobile lower limbs joints. Children with mild and moderate spasticity ( i.e. grade 1 and 2, according to Modified Ashworth Scale). Children with severe spasticity ( i.e. grade 4, according to Modified Ashworth Scale). Fixed deformities. Uncontrolled seizures.
